title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 2370.6 - Inspecting and copying of records
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 2370.6 - Inspecting and copying of records

State Regulations
(a) If access to records is granted, records
may be inspected or copied by the public at the office of the records access
officer every day that the offices of the department are open for business
during the hours--9 a.m. through 12 p.m. and 1 p.m. through 4 p.m. At the sole
discretion of the records access officer, such records may also be inspected or
copied at an office of an assistant records access officer. (b) If a record is of a type available for
inspection under the Freedom of Information Law but contains information, details and/or particulars requiring deletion, a requester shall only be
permitted to inspect a copy of the deleted record. (c) Records inspected may be copied in the
following manners: (1)

By the person
inspecting the record in his own handwriting or by his own
typewriting. (2)

The records may be
copied for the person inspecting the records by department personnel using
department mechanical reproduction equipment. (i) The copying of records by department
personnel will be allowed only when such copying will not delay the use of the
department's mechanical reproduction equipment for departmental
business. (ii)

Copies of records
produced by department personnel using department mechanical reproduction
equipment will be provided only when the fee for such copies as prescribed by
this Part has been paid to the records access officer. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
2370.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
